intro: Calcitrapa idaea, commonly known as the lesser burnet, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit and is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, pinkish to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive, velvety appearance. Calcitrapa idaea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
